com.opencredo.concursus.domain.events.cataloguing

Interface AggregateCatalogue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Consumer<Event>, EventOutChannel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CassandraAggregateCatalogue, InMemoryAggregateCatalogue, RedisAggregateCatalogue

    public interface AggregateCatalogue
extends EventOutChannel
    A catalogue of "active" aggregates, i.e. those that have received an initial event, but have not yet received a terminal event.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void accept(Event event)
      If the received Event is an initial event, add the aggregate to the catalogue.
      void add(String aggregateType, UUID aggregateId)
      Add an aggregate to the catalogue.
      List<UUID> getUuids(String aggregateType)
      Obtain a List of all the aggregate Ids in the catalogue for the given type.
      void remove(String aggregateType, UUID aggregateId)
      Remove an aggregate from the catalogue.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Consumer

        andThen

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(String aggregateType,
         UUID aggregateId)
        Add an aggregate to the catalogue.
        Parameters:
        aggregateType - The type of the aggregate.
        aggregateId - The id of the aggregate.

      • remove

        void remove(String aggregateType,
            UUID aggregateId)
        Remove an aggregate from the catalogue.
        Parameters:
        aggregateType - The type of the aggregate.
        aggregateId - The id of the aggregate;

      • getUuids

        List<UUID> getUuids(String aggregateType)
        Obtain a List of all the aggregate Ids in the catalogue for the given type.
        Parameters:
        aggregateType - The aggregate type to retrieve ids for.
        Returns:
        The List of retrieved ids.

      • accept

        default void accept(Event event)
        If the received Event is an initial event, add the aggregate to the catalogue. If it is a terminal event, remove the aggregate from the catalogue.
        Specified by:
        accept in interface java.util.function.Consumer<Event>
        Specified by:
        accept in interface EventOutChannel
        Parameters:
        event - The Event to observe.
